toast.servererror: The server has encountered an error. Please review your configuration and try again
toast.copiedtoclipboard: Console output has been copied to clipboard

destroyserver.title: Are you sure want to destroy this server?
destroyserver.text: The virtual machine will be deleted, but the server and its configuration and files will remain intact.

deleteserver.title: Are you sure want to delete this server?
deleteserver.text: You're about to delete this server. You can remove the server only from the list, while keeping its files on disk, or you can delete the server and its files as well. The original installer files you might have selected during the configuration process will not be deleted.

installerhash.title: Warning
installerhash.text: The selected file does not seem to match a supported %1 installer. Are you sure want to use it?

hotfixhash.title: Warning
hotfixhash.text: The selected file does not seem to match a supported %1 hotfix. Are you sure want to use it?

fixpackhash.title: Warning
fixpackhash.text: The selected file does not seem to match a supported %1 fixpack. Are you sure want to use it?

notsupportedcpu.title: Unsupported CPU
notsupportedcpu.text: The CPU architecture (%1) of this computer is currently not supported. We're constantly updating the application, please check back later for support for your CPU. Thank you

crash.title: Crash Detected
crash.text: Super.Human.Installer crashed during the previous session. You can open and ispect the crash log, or you can create an issue on GitHub.

aboutpage.title: Welcome to %1
aboutpage.about: %1 is a part of Genesis.Directory App Catalog where you can deploy and update your open source applications with 1 line
aboutpage.genesislink: Click here to find out more
aboutpage.aboutopensource: %1 is Open Source Software (OSS). Open source software (OSS) is software that is distributed with its source code, making it available for use, modification, and distribution with its original rights.

supportpage.title: Issues, problems, errors? Send us your log files
supportpage.text: If you run into issues, experience errors using %1, you can email us your log files. Click the button below to locate %1's logs, and attach current.txt and last.txt to the email you'll be sending to support@prominic.net. By sending us your log files, you accept %2's Privacy Policy
supportpage.visitgithub: Create a new issue on GitHub
supportpage.visitgithubtext: Alternatively you can open a new issue in our public code repository

helppage.title: How %1 Works
helppage.text:
%1 leverages the VirtualBox virtual machine manager and the Vagrant DevOps software automation tool to create a Linux based VM on your local computer. There will be one for each Domino server you create.

You should only run 1-2 at a time, depending upon your computer's resources. You can define as many as you like, and in each one you can experiment with different configurations and Genesis.Directory add-ons -- or your own development ideas!

The specific steps which are followed based upon the user interface presented by the Super.Human.Installer application are written to a configuration file called a YAML file. This YAML file provides instructions to Vagrant such as which version of Domino to install and whether to include additional features like Nomad Web and Node.js development using the AppDev Pack.

The actual control files and scripts can be inspected by you by clicking the Open Server Directory button on any of the existing server instances.
helppage.disclaimer: All trademarks, logos and brand names are the property of their respective owners

updatepage.title: A new version of %1 is available
updatepage.text: Version %1 is available to download. Please click the "Download" button to download and launch the updated installer

hostname.tooltip: Minimum 1 character long. Allowed characters: alphanumeric, hyphen (-), and dot (.)

orgcert.tooltip: The name the organization certifier, at least 1 character long, alphanumeric characters and hyphens only (e.g. STARTcloud)

safeid.tooltip: Click to locate your Notes Safe ID

roles.tooltip: Click to locate your Notes Safe ID

syncmethod.warning:
File synchronization requires rsync version higher than 2.6.9. Please upgrade rsync using MacPorts or Homebrew package managers. 
Alternatively, you can use the SCP plugin, though it may result in slower transfer speeds compared to rsync.

form.info:
Fields marked with * are mandatory
Some settings cannot be edited unless the server has been destroyed first

dhcp.tooltip: If enabled, IP addresses will be automatically assigned by the system

nameserver1.tooltip: Custom IP address of your NameServer

nameserver2.tooltip: Custom IP address of your NameServer

alertemail.tooltip: Please fill in if you'd like to receive email alerts (optional)

cpu.tooltip: Please select the number of CPU cores that will be allocated for the server

ram.tooltip: Please select number of allocated memory in GigaBytes. A minimum of 4GB is recommended

misc.openbrowser: Open Welcome page if server has started

form.info:
Fields marked with * are mandatory
Some settings cannot be edited unless the server has been destroyed first

role.noinstaller: Please enable role to select installer %1

nomadweb.desc: HCL Nomad Web allows for browser-based access to native Notes Domino applications without the need to install a full Notes Client on your desktop

leap.desc: HCL Domino Leap is a new low-code capability that makes it easy to develop powerful, secure, and enterprise-grade workflow-based applications

traveler.desc: HCL Traveler provides automatic, two-way, over-the-air syncing between HCL Domino servers and wireless handheld devices

verse.desc: HCL Verse is an advanced, person-centric webmail interface.  Define your personal VIPs and never miss important messages again

appdevpack.desc: The AppDev Pack primarily adds Node.js support to Domino Server

domino-rest-api.desc: The HCL Domino REST APIs (previously known as HCL Project KEEP) provide secure REST APIs with access to HCL Domino servers and databases.

vagrant.title: Warning: Vagrant is not installed or an unsupported version is installed
vagrant.text: Please install at least Vagrant v2.3.4 before using Super.Human.Installer

virtualbox.title: Warning: VirtualBox is not installed
virtualbox.text: Please install VirtualBox before using Super.Human.Installer
